qas.question: In what country is Limón Creole English spoken?
On what coast of Costa Rica is Limón Creole English spoken?
Speakers of Limón Creole English are descended from people of what nationality?

plausible_answers.text: There is no universally accepted criterion

qas.question: How many universally accepted criterion for distinguishing between two languages from two dialects are there?
What does the position which Costa Rican linguists oppose depend on?
What does the position which Jamaican linguists support depend on?

context: <b3_0>There is no universally accepted criterion<b3_0/> for distinguishing two different languages from two dialects (i.e. varieties) of the same language. A number of rough measures exist, sometimes leading to contradictory results. The distinction is therefore subjective and depends on the user's frame of reference. For example, there is discussion about if the Limón Creole English must be considered as "a kind" of English or a different language. This creole is spoken in the <a1_0><b4_0>Caribbean<a1_0/> coast of <a0_0>Costa Rica<a0_0/> (<b4_0/>Central America) by <b5_0>descendant of <a2_0>Jamaican<a2_0/> people<b5_0/>. The position that Costa Rican linguists support depends on <b6_0><b7_0>the University they belong.
